question: According to the newly-adopted Constitution of Russia which among the following appoint the Prime Minister of Russia?
option1: the State Duma, the Lower Chamber of the Federal Assembly
option2: the President, with the consent of the State Duma
option3: the President, with the consent of the Federal Council
answer: the President, with the consent of the State Duma
explanation: In Soviet times, Prime Minister of the Russian SFSR was appointed by the Supreme Council after each election. Currently Prime Minister is appointed by the President of Russia, subject to the consent of the State Duma.
